Yale is more than an institution of higher learning; it is a community where people of diverse cultures and nationalities live, work, and play — connected by their similarities and enriched by their differences.

Our community members have a wide range of talents, interests, vocations, and needs, and the university is committed to providing the services and opportunities to keep them strong in mind, body, and spirit.
We celebrate our hometown of New Haven, CT for all that it offers, including its renowned restaurants, shops, and cultural attractions.
Discover the countless ways that creativity and diversity bloom on the Yale campus.
Both on and off the playing field, there are many sports programs to cheer about at Yale.
Explore this campus-wide resource on diversity, equity, and inclusion.
We strive to keep our students, staff, and faculty healthy in every respect.
See why Yale’s hometown is the cultural capital of Connecticut and a magnet for “foodies.”
From the residential colleges to off-campus apartments, there are a variety of housing options for members of the Yale community.
Yale community members are dedicated to transforming the world for the better.
Whatever your interests, you’ll find fellow enthusiasts in one of our hundreds of student groups.
Learn about all the services and resources available to Yale College, graduate, and professional school students and scholars.
